text: happy Halloween at how to address well
laugh remains hello my needle drops
Anthony Fantan oh here internets busiest
music nerd and it's time to dish out
some more unadulterated opinion on a new
album review how to dress wells love
remains this LP has seriously been
ravaging the comments section on a lot
of my videos it's been requested by
people like b53 sterics which jewish and
one sane maniac but seriously there are
way too many requests for this album to
count so while the hype around this
thing it did get a glowing review from
pitchfork it did get pimped out by some
experimental music blogs and the general
consensus around this album is that it's
unlike anything else you'll stumble upon
this year and I could hang with that
last statement this thing most
definitely is unlike anything I've heard
in 2010 but I wouldn't say how to dress
well is completely coming out of left
field ooh totally unpredictable all the
elements and the concepts of love
remains I am familiar with but it's how
they're combined that makes this thing
so unusual original and strange from my
point of view this thing is very much an
album of ambient music a lot of
electronic elements but kind of the
kicker with this LP something that
people really make a big stink about is
that there is a heavy R&B influence
coming through on the vocal melodies and
the lyrics but all R&B influences aside
lover means is an album that very much
gets its strength from atmosphere much
like the new AV tere album down there
listening to this is a lot like being
somewhere feeling like you are in a
place a very cold
dark cavernous eerie lonely place to me
and what are the sounds that create this
atmosphere
it really depends track to track but no
matter what song you're listening to you
can usually count on some samples some
loops very chilly synths and mastermind
creator Tom Krell's very high pitched
vocals just drenched in reverb to me it
kind of sounds like if lust more
collaborated with woods on some cover
songs of obscure R&B jams from the 80s
and 90s to me it's an interesting take
on a style of music that just isn't
championed all that too often in the
indie sphere my main gripe with love
remains though and I know everybody's
going to be disappointed to hear this
who loves this album but the low fire
recording destroys this album for me
destroys it it's hard to enjoy the
sounds and the ambience of this album
when nearly every moment is being
interrupted by the shrill over
modulation the shrill peaking of Tom
Krell's voice every single time he sings
above the volume of a whisper and this
isn't just any over modulation just any
kind of peaking it's the sound of pins
and needles being rapid fired into my
ear canals over and over and over until
blood starts pouring out of my eyes at
best love remains sounds like it was
recorded on a MacBook at the bottom of a
well now I don't think I need to defend
myself on the whole recording debacle by
now there are plenty of albums that I
love that ride the lo-fi lightning what
makes this LP the exception though is
it's not like the songwriting is so
stand out that it makes listening past
the lo-fi worth it and that's not
necessarily because Tom Krell can't
write a song but like I said earlier
this LP isn't really about songs it's
not about the catchy hooks it's not
about the sweet melodic guitar licks
it's about atmosphere and I see I hear
the fidelity of this album destroying
that atmosphere that I'm trying to
partake in I felt like a majority of the
time I
was not enjoying what I was actually
listening to but kind of imagining how
much I would like it if it were recorded
well I'm feeling a strong three to a
light four on this LP but you guys know
that's just opinion nothing that you
need to take seriously if you enjoy this
album if you're enjoying it enjoy it let
me know in the comments below what you
think I should review next be it an
album or a track and that's it thanks
for watching guys and I hope everybody's
doing well hope everyone's having a good
autumn Anthony Fantana
how to dress well love remains forever
you
